alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 12:16PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including Teec Nos Pos, Twin Falls and the Four Corners area. * WHEN...Until 215 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Blackrock Wash, Pine Wash, Horse Mesa Creek, Blackhorse Creek, Teec Nos Pos Wash, Tsitah Wash, Dry Farm Wash, Kit Sili Wash, White Rock Wash, Walker Creek, Toh Dahstini Wash and Sweetwater Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Twin Falls, Teec Nos Pos and the Four Corners area. - This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 454 and 470. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
